poem:
**Necessary Distances**  

In the hushed-morning air,  
an ocean's wide breath  
whispers across hearts—  

once close, bonded  
like dawn's first light—  
now merely a gaze,  

a handshake of necessity,  
bridges that hold  
but don't bind,  

the transient tether  
of an essential breeze,  
alight yet not allied.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Most Europeans see Trump’s US as more a necessary partner than ally, poll finds Donald Trump’s return to the White House has led to a “remarkable shift” in Europeans’ view of the US, according to a survey, with even the most America-friendly no longer seeing Washington primarily as an ally. The polling, of 11 EU member states plus Ukraine, Switzerland and the UK, found most people now regarded the US as merely a “necessary partner”". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Most Europeans see Trump’s US as more a necessary partner than ally, poll finds Donald Trump’s return to the White House has led to a “remarkable shift” in Europeans’ view of the US, according to a survey, with even the most America-friendly no longer seeing Washington primarily as an ally. The polling, of 11 EU member states plus Ukraine, Switzerland and the UK, found most people now regarded the US as merely a “necessary partner”
